metadata.titel_preek: The Trinitarian Blessing and the Depths of Mercy

kernfrasen: parent of a child... on the verge of self-destruction
inner core of being is love
pay a ransom, mortgage the house
enough credits to come into the presence of God
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS DEBT / SALVATION IS DEBT CANCELLATION

kernfrasen: there is no health in us

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The Corinthian church has gone completely off the rails.

cognitieve_implicaties: The church is moving toward a crash
It cannot fix itself without being lifted back on the track
theologische_implicaties: Orthodoxy provides the necessary 'groove' for communal life
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests a mechanical view of faith where one is either 'on' or 'off'

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A common idiom used to describe loss of control, though here applied to a 1st-century context.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

theologische_implicaties: Grace is not cheap; it is 'spent' life
onbedoelde_consequenties: Could imply God the Father 'uses up' the Son

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Combines economic 'spending' with the visceral 'blood' to re-sensitize the hearer to the Passion.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the Relational (Parent) and Economic (Debt/Ransom) domains by framing the 'spending' not as a cold transaction, but as the desperate act of a loving father.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: Sin as Sickness ('no health in us')
incoherentie_punten.metafoor_b: Sin as Legal/Economic Debt ('note what is done amiss')
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Sickness implies a lack of agency/victimhood, while debt/offense implies moral culpability.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: If I am sick, I need a doctor; if I am a 'miserable offender,' I need a judge/pardon.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The economic cost is used to measure the depth of the relational bond.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-animates the 'dead' Trinitarian formula by grounding it in the visceral anxiety of a parent with a wayward child.
sterktes.voorbeeld: You would make a complete fool of yourself if you thought it might get your child’s attention.

risicos.beschrijving: Heavy reliance on the Father-Child metaphor may alienate those with paternal trauma, though the preacher attempts to mitigate this by mentioning aunts/grandmothers.
risicos.voorbeeld: For many of us, this was our parents... some of us will have had parents who failed us.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants with 'father-wounds' may struggle to map God's love correctly.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A modern household in crisis (drugs, anorexia, runaway child).

deictic_shifts.van_wereld: The relational space of the Trinity
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective shift from 'God's nature' to 'Human condition'.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By defending the phrase 'there is no health in us' and 'miserable offenders'.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Contrasting 'petty record keeping' with 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strong; specifically addresses changes in the Book of Common Prayer (1976).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational domain, specifically the 'Desperate Parent' archetype. This is effectively used to explain the Trinity not as a mathematical puzzle, but as a 'dynamic interrelatedness.' The secondary domain is Economic (Debt/Redemption), which provides the necessary weight to the concept of Sin.

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: Washed in the blood / Spent blood
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'spending' of blood to the 'neglect of health' mentioned in the parental analogy.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God, like a parent who forgets to eat or sleep for a sick child, pours out his very life-force.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Anorexia' example from the intro to bridge them—anorexia is both a 'sickness' and a 'self-destructive choice,' requiring both a doctor and a savior.

entailment_checks.metafoor: GOD IS A FOOL FOR LOVE
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests God might be incompetent or lacks sovereignty.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that this 'foolishness' is the 'wisdom of the Cross' (1 Cor 1), not a lack of power.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'depths' of the Psalm with the 'foundation' of the Trinity.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to make high-level Trinitarian dogma accessible through embodied, parental experience.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'poetic' nature of the De Profundis, CMT reveals how the 'depths' function as a spatial container for human despair.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT shows how the preacher uses 'Source Domains' (parenting) to overwrite 'Dysfunctional Schemas' (God as a cop).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the 'Fear of the Lord' is cognitively mapped as a response to 'Incomprehensible Magnitude' (Verticality/Size) rather than just 'Terror' (Force).

appendices.notities: The preacher uses spatial metaphors (depths, high, entrance) to navigate the emotional landscape of the sermon.
